# ICCSA 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 International Conference on Computational Science and Its Applications (ICCSA 2025) will be held from **June 30 to July 3, 2025**, at **Galatasaray University, Istanbul, TÃ¼rkiye**.

ICCSA 2025 offers both **onsite and online participation options**, with virtual registration available at a reduced fee to accommodate researchers in challenging economic and political situations.

## Conference Scope and Goals

Computational science is central to most current research, industrial, and commercial activities, uniquely exploiting innovative ICT technologies. The ICCSA Conference offers an opportunity to bring together scientists from different disciplines, discuss new issues, tackle complex problems, and find advanced solutions that breed new trends in computational science.

## Review Process

Submitted papers will be subject to **stringent peer review** by at least three experts and carefully evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity of exposition. A **single blind review** method will be used, ensuring the publication of only top-quality contributions.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be included in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series. These proceedings are indexed by Scopus, EI Engineering Index, Thomson Reuters Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in ISI Web of Science), and several other indexing services. Papers will include linked references, XML versions, and citable DOI numbers. Authors of a selected number of top-quality papers will be invited to extend their papers for publication as special issues in highly recognized international journals.

## Warning: Fake ICCSA Conference

Be aware of organizations like WASET that run fake "conferences" by spoofing the names of real conferences. The Real ICCSA conference has been organised by the ICCSA Society since 2003. Please spread this news to your contacts and communities to avoid participation in fake conferences.

    *   Format: According to LNCS rules. Visit [https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors](https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors) for templates.

# ICDS 2025: Call for Papers

The Nineteenth International Conference on Digital Society (ICDS 2025) will be held from **May 18, 2025 to May 22, 2025** in **Nice, France**.

### Onsite and Online Options

ICDS 2025 offers the option for either physical presence or virtual participation (pdf slides or pre-recorded videos) to accommodate various situations.

## Scope

ICDS 2025 continues a series of international events covering a large spectrum of topics related to advanced networking, applications, and systems technologies in a digital society. The conference aims to address the challenges of monitoring, controlling, and managing digital systems, ensuring user privacy and safety, and leveraging progress in cognitive science and knowledge management.

The annual IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) is one of the premier conferences in data and information engineering. ICDE 2025 will take place in **Hong Kong SAR, China**, from **May 19 â€“ 23, 2025**.

*   AI for Database Systems and Database Systems for AI

*   **Length:** Research papers must not exceed **12 pages** not including the references. No appendix is allowed.
*   **File Type:** Only electronic submissions in **PDF format** will be considered.
*   **Originality:** A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 cannot be under review for any other conference or journal during the entire time it is considered for ICDE 2025, and it must be substantially different from any previously published work. *   **Author Limit:** Any author of ICDE 2025 should not be a co-author of more than **10 submitted research papers** across the two submission rounds.

# ICIDS 2025: Call for Papers

The 18th International Conference on Interactive Digital Storytelling (ICIDS 2025) will be held from **December 1-5, 2025**, in **Malta**.

## Theme: Kaleidoscopic Machines

This year's conference explores the increasing injection of generative AI into the development, performance, and analysis of Interactive Digital Narratives (IDNs). Inspired by Janet Murray's concept of IDNs as environments fostering multiple contexts and variants of scenarios, the theme "Kaleidoscopic Machines" highlights the collaboration between AI and human creators to generate new narrative possibilities. The conference aims to analyze the past, present current thinking, and contemplate future directions in the field, reflecting on AI's influence on creation and creativity.

## Areas of Interest

Submissions are invited into the following broad areas:

*   **Theory, History, and Foundations:** Exploring fundamental, theoretical aspects of interactive digital storytelling, narrative structures, interactivity, and conceptual underpinnings of IDNs, including historical context.
*   **Methods and Tools:** Research on frameworks, procedures, and pipelines supporting analysis of principles, methods, rules, and postulates in the field, as well as innovative tools, methodologies, and technical frameworks for creating IDNs.
*   **Applications and Case Studies:** Explorations of interactive digital storytelling in practice, including educational applications, collaborative narrative experiences, virtual worlds, games, and performances, focusing on audience engagement and practical outcomes.
*   **Social, Cultural and Critical Perspectives:** Analysis of sociocultural implications and ethical dimensions of interactive digital storytelling, including representation, accessibility, cultural context, power dynamics, and authorship issues.

## Submission Categories

Papers may be either long or short, presenting novel work at various stages of completion.

*   **Full papers:** 4000-6000 words (excluding references), to be published in the proceedings.
*   **Short papers:** 2000-4000 words (excluding references), to be published in the proceedings.
*   **Late Breaking Work:** 2000-3000 words (excluding references), to be published in the proceedings. These are for works in progress, working systems, or brief research project explanations, presented as a demo or poster.

*   **Anonymization:** ICIDS follows a strict double-peer review process; please fully anonymize your paper. Non-anonymized papers will be desk-rejected.
*   **Language & Format:** Papers must be written in English, and only electronic submissions in PDF format will be considered for review.
*   **Publication:** Publication in the conference proceedings is conditional on a minimum of one author registering for the conference to present the work.

# Call for Papers

The purpose of the **International Conference on Informatics in Control, Automation and Robotics (ICINCO)** is to bring together researchers, engineers and practitioners interested in the application of informatics to Control, Automation and Robotics.

ICINCO 2025 will be held from **October 20-22, 2025**, at the BarcelÃ³ Marbella hotel, Costa del Sol.

## Scope

ICINCO covers four simultaneous tracks related to Intelligent Control Systems, Optimization, Robotics, Automation, Signal Processing, Sensors, Systems Modelling and Control, and Industrial Informatics. Authors are encouraged to highlight the benefits of Information Technology (IT) in these areas, including ideas for solving problems in R&D and industrial applications. Papers detailing advanced prototypes, systems, tools, techniques, and general survey papers indicating future directions are welcome. Papers describing original work are invited.

Both full research reports and work-in-progress reports are accepted. There will be oral and poster sessions. Special sessions for case studies and commercial presentations, as well as tutorials, are also envisaged.

## Conference Areas

1.  **Intelligent Control Systems and Optimization**
2.  **Robotics and Automation**
3.  **Signal Processing, Sensors, Systems Modelling and Control**
4.  **Industrial Informatics**

## Keynote Speakers

*   Robert Babuska, Delft University of Technology, Netherlands
*   Uzay Kaymak, Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands
*   Michael Berthold, University of Konstanz / KNIME AG, Germany

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts will be presented but not published in the proceedings. Complete papers can be submitted as a **Regular Paper** (completed and validated research) or a **Position Paper** (work in progress or an arguable opinion).

Submissions must be in English, with careful attention to grammar and spelling. Papers should clearly indicate the nature of their contribution and applicability. For double-blind evaluation, papers must be submitted without any author identification (personal details, acknowledgments, etc.).

Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism; submissions with plagiarism will be rejected. Excessive self-citations should be avoided.

All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS**. Authors should follow the provided guidelines and templates.

## Publications

All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings with an ISBN, in both paper and digital formats. SCITEPRESS is a CrossRef member, and each paper in the digital library receives a DOI.

The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index.

# Call for Papers

The 19th International Conference on Information Technology and Applications (ICITA 2025) will be held in **Oslo, Norway** on **14 - 16 October 2025**.

ICITA 2025 is a **hybrid event**, offering both **Online and Face to Face** participation options.

This conference serves as a significant annual event in Information Technology (IT), providing a high-quality platform for academics and industry professionals worldwide to exchange knowledge on the state-of-the-art research and development in IT and its applications. It aims to facilitate cross-disciplinary and social gatherings, allowing participants to establish new links and extend professional networks.

## Topics of Interest

The conference focuses on Information Technology and Applications, welcoming contributions on specific disciplinary research as well as multi-disciplinary studies. It also facilitates discussions on technical issues and other areas where technology is applied.

## Publication

All accepted and registered papers will be published as book chapters in a high-quality book by **Springer** in the "**Lecture Notes in Network Systems Series**".

*   **ISSN (Print):** 2367-3370
*   **ISSN (Electronic):** 2367-3389

Full and short papers will be submitted for indexation by **ISI, EI-Compendex, and SCOPUS**, among others, and will be available in the SpringerLink Digital Library.

Specific submission deadlines, notification dates, and camera-ready deadlines are not detailed in the provided text. The conference dates are **14 - 16 October 2025**.

Detailed submission guidelines, paper formats, and contribution types are not explicitly provided in the available text.

The Ninth International Conference on Imaging, Signal Processing and Communications (ICISPC 2025) will be held in **Osaka, Japan** during **July 11-13, 2025**. ## Scope and Subtopics

# ICMLA 2025: Call for Papers

ICMLA 2025 aims to bring together researchers and practitioners to present their latest achievements and innovations in the area of machine learning (ML).

The conference provides a leading international forum for the dissemination of original research in ML, with emphasis on applications as well as novel algorithms and systems. Following the success of previous ICMLA conferences, the conference aims to attract researchers and application developers from a wide range of ML related areas, and the recent emergence of Big Data processing brings an urgent need for machine learning to address these new challenges. The conference will cover both machine learning theoretical research and its applications. Contributions describing machine learning techniques applied to real-world problems and interdisciplinary research involving machine learning, in fields like medicine, biology, industry, manufacturing, security, education, virtual environments, games, are especially encouraged.

Contributions describing applications of machine learning (ML) techniques to real-world problems, interdisciplinary research involving machine learning, experimental and/or theoretical studies yielding new insights into the design of ML systems, and papers describing development of new analytical frameworks that advance practical machine learning methods are especially encouraged.

## Topics of Interest

The technical program will consist of, but is not limited to, the following topics of interest:

*   Statistical learning

## Applications of Machine Learning

*   Industrial and engineering applications
*   Security applications
*   Smart cities and autonomous driving
*   Game playing and problem solving
*   Intelligent virtual environments
*   Economics, business and forecasting applications, etc.

## Paper Submission

# ICIW 2025: Call for Papers

The Twentieth International Conference on Internet and Web Applications and Services (ICIW 2025) will take place from **April 06, 2025 to April 10, 2025**, in **Valencia, Spain**.

### Onsite and Online Options

To accommodate various situations, ICIW 2025 offers options for either **physical presence** or **virtual participation** (via PDF slides or pre-recorded videos).

## Introduction

ICIW 2025 continues a series of co-located events focusing on the complementary aspects related to the design and deployment of applications based on IP and Web techniques and mechanisms. The conference comprises multiple tracks covering Web technologies, design and development of Web-based applications, and their interactions with other systems. It also addresses management aspects, challenges in specialized domains, evaluation techniques, and standard positions on various topics.

The event explores how Internet and Web-based technologies have led to new frameworks, languages, mechanisms, and protocols for Web applications. It also delves into Web Services, entertainment systems, P2P applications, online communications, collaborative systems, social networks, and their implications for education and business in a globalized, ubiquitous environment.

*   **Accepted File Types:** Only `.pdf` or `.doc` files will be accepted for paper submission.
*   **Page Limit:** Final author manuscripts will be 8.5" x 11", not exceeding **6 pages**; a maximum of **4 extra pages** are allowed at additional cost.
*   **Templates:**

Also, `iaria-lite` (compatible with any TeX stack, but does not provide IARIA citation formatting). A minimal working example is available as an [Overleaf template](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/iaria-template/jkmprpqckwjg).
